msIdentifier.idno: P. Leiden Pap. Inst, inv. Warren 6

msContents.summary: Herakleides receives from Athene a certain amount of gold and clothes in order to keep them at his own risk; he shall give them back as soon as Athene asks for the return. This in fact concerns Athene's dowry.

msItemStruct.note: Editio princeps: A.S. Hunt, Aegyptus 13 (1933) 243f. = SB V 7535

condition.ab: Yellow papyrus of moderate quality, holes, right part and end of text missing

listBibl.bibl: M. David - B.A. van Groningen - J.C. van Oven, The Warren Papyri (P. Warren) (Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava 1, Leiden 1941), p. 17-19 = P.Warren 6, also cited as P.L.Bat. I 6

div.ab: (Translation from P.L.Bat. I 6) In the 7th year of Imperatores [Caesares Lucius] Septimius Severus [Pius Pertinax] Arabicus Adiabenicus Parthicus [Maximus and Marcus Aurelius] Antoninus Pius Augusti, [month] the (5) 1[.]th day at Ptolemais Euergetis [in the Arsinoite nome.] Herakleides - - - of Heron, registered in the Dionysios-Places-quarter, [aged about . .] years, having a scar on the small finger of the left hand, acknowledges [to Athene, daughter of - - - the son of - - los,] registered in the village of Hiera Nesos [in the Polemon district, aged about .. years, having a scar] (10) on the right brow, with the assistance of - -, [registered in the] Dionysios-Places-quarter, aged about .. years - - -, that the acknowledging party [Herakleides has received in cash] four tetartae of gold - - - and clothes to a value of [- - - silver drachmae,] (15) the whole of it being a deposit exempt [from every risk] and free from any deduction. And the acknowledging party Herakleides [shall keep (?) it and give it back] to Athene whenever she wishes, [without delay] or subterfuge, she having the right of execution (20) as fixed for reclamations, upon Herakleides and all his property [whatsoever it may be,] as if in accordance with a legal decision. Signatory [on behalf of the acknowledging persons] who declare themselves illiterate, - - aged about 2 [.] years, without ditinguishing marks - -.
